intro: Polycarpaea corymbosa var. longipetala, commonly known as the long-petioled polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The species is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This variant is distinguished by its elongated petioles, which give it a distinctive appearance in its natural habitat.
